page.title: 06EDUCATION - COITY SCHOOL
page.content: In the year l876 a group decided that a school should be built in Coity. It was built of stone which was quarried near by and it consisted of four rooms. One of the rooms was actually the headmasters house. Two of the rooms could be opened into a large room. All children up to 7 years of age were in one classroom, up to ll years old in another, the top class had children until they left at l4. In l898 a school house was built and the headmasters old house became a classroom. The rooms were heated by large open fires. The toilets were out in the yard. In l966 a new block of 2 classrooms was built in the field for the Infants, then in l97l a new hall, kitchen, staffroom and children's toilets were added to the school.
